meanings.definition: A feeling of intense disgust or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The sight of spiders fills me with repulsion.
meanings.sent2: Her repulsion towards the smell of rotten eggs was evident.
meanings.sent3: The repulsion towards broccoli was so strong, she ran out of the room.
meanings.sent4: The repulsion towards the idea was like a physical barrier between them.
meanings.sent5: The repulsion she felt towards the slimy texture was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: The action of repelling or driving back.
meanings.sent1: The repulsion of the magnet against the other was strong.
meanings.sent2: The repulsion of the two opposing forces created a powerful reaction.
meanings.sent3: The repulsion of the ball hitting the wall made it bounce back quickly.
meanings.sent4: The repulsion of the waves crashing against the rocks was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The repulsion of the spring pushed the door closed with force.

meanings.definition: The force by which bodies of the same electric charge or magnetic polarity repel one another.
meanings.sent1: The repulsion between the positively charged particles caused them to move apart.
meanings.sent2: The repulsion between the magnets made them push away from each other.
meanings.sent3: The repulsion between the like charges was like a magnetic dance.
meanings.sent4: The repulsion between the electrons kept the atoms stable.
meanings.sent5: The repulsion between the north poles of the magnets was undeniable.
